result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony Ray Kittrell

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:02 AM Defendant Tony Ray Kittrell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Tony Ray Kittrell.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Attny Thomas-Schmidt  acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:36 AM Defendant Tony Ray Kittrell appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Tony Ray Kittrell.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Thomas-Schmidt indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness, Sawyer County Deputy Schick, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.   11:42 AM  Witness identified the DEF,  Attny Thomas-Schmidt no objection, Court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.  11:44 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Thomas-Schmidt.     11:45 AM Attny Thomas-Schmidt no further questions.  11:45 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Thomas-Schmidt  no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:12 AM Defendant Tony Ray Kittrell appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Tony Ray Kittrell.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Court reviews criminal complaint with DEF.  Attny Thomas-Schmidt request preliminary hearing to be set.  Court sets.  Bond Continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 11:15 am.

May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:21 AM DE Tony R. Kittrell in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance). Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does not qualify for public defender. Court gives the DEF the attorney colloquy.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation (CBS $500 with no contacts).  Atty Pollak no objection.  Court disagrees with bond recommendation, and makes statement.  Court sets bond.  Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for  at 8:30AM.
